Observer Staff Report  Wednesday April  

An individual reported multiple instances of simple assault to a University administrator Monday according to Tuesdays Notre Dame Security Police NDSP crime log PERIOD

A simple assault is defined as an instance when a person knowingly or intentionally touches another person in a rude insolent or angry manner University spokesperson Dennis Brown said in an email PERIOD

This definition is part of Indiana code Brown said and differentiates the crime from other types of assault such as aggravated domestic or sexual assault or battery PERIOD

The alleged assault occurred multiple times in a Notre Dame residence hall according to the log entry PERIOD The incident was classified as a Title IX offense in the log which Brown said was because of who received the initial report PERIOD

Students did not receive an email from the University alerting them that a report had been filed because the crime was not deemed a timely threat based on the information available at this time Brown said PERIOD This is in accordance with the Clery Act regulations PERIOD
